Advanced data
Item ID6034

Supercompost is a superior version of compost that is used in the Farming skill to reduce the chance of a farming patch becoming diseased per growth stage by 6/7.[1] When used on a farming patch, each bucket grants 26 Farming experience.

In addition, it also increases the minimum yield and maximum number of harvests received from allotments, hops and herbs.[2] The minimum number of herbs per harvest increases to 5 (when compared with compost). This also applies to giant seaweed patches underwater[3] and Celastrus bark from a fully grown Celastrus seed.[4]

As a rule of thumb, supercompost should only be used on farming patches that produce a valuable harvest (such as high-level herbs) and/or provide significant experience for each item harvested (such as watermelons). Supercompost does not increase the yield of trees, fruit trees, cactus, or bush patches; therefore, it is not recommended to treat those patches with supercompost if you plan to pay a gardener to watch over them, since there is no benefit other than the extra 26 experience granted.

Players can add two volcanic ash to a bucket of supercompost, or add 25 volcanic ash to a compost bin that contains supercompost, to upgrade it to ultracompost.

Farming info[edit | edit source]

Supercompost
Level required 1
Farming XP26 xp
Farming patchAny un-supercomposted farming patch

Creation[edit | edit source]

To create supercompost, players must place 15 suitable produce (see list below) into any of the compost bins that are located next to the allotment patches found around Gielinor. Once the bin is full, the lid of the compost bin must be closed to allow the contents to rot. This process takes approximately 90 minutes until completion, after which the player may open the compost bin and extract all of the supercompost by clicking on the bin or using buckets on it. Each bucket of supercompost collected grants the player 8.5 Farming experience.

Players may also use a compost potion to create supercompost. One dose of compost potion will change an entire finished bin of compost into supercompost, or one bucket of compost that has already been collected.

Supercompost can be purchased with reward points from the Tithe Farm minigame, for 5 points each.

The Lunar spell Fertile Soil can be used on a patch to apply the effect of supercompost to it without using any supercompost.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
10 September 2020
(update)

The Grand Exchange buy limit was changed from 600 to 2,000.

28 April 2016
(update | poll)

It is now possible to add compost or supercompost to any farming patch during any growth stage of a crop.

4 – 29 January 2007

The item was renamed from "Super compost" to "Supercompost".

22 March 2006
(update)

The item was graphically updated.

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 8 September 2017. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Kieren: "So with the release of Ultracompost I figured I'd explain how compost affects crops dying. Sorry it is very word heavy! Fire any questions:)"
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "[Flower/berry/cactus patches] don't depend on the compost state. Allotments, hops and herbs do."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 72 July 2018. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "[Does compost increase giant seaweed yield?] Yeah."
  4. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Yes, celastrus would be helped by composting."
